Amazon $AMZN recently announced that it is planning to invest $20 billion to build 2 AI data centers in Pennsylvania, with one alongside the Susquehanna nuclear power plant.

$NVDA $MSFT $GOOG
Nvidia $NVDA CEO Jensen Huang predicted that Europe's AI compute capacity will increase by 10x over the next two years.
Broadcom $AVGO hinted that its AI revenue could potentially close in on $30 billion in 2026.

CoreWeave $CRWV is said to be providing compute capacity to Google Cloud $GOOG, which will then sell that to OpenAI to help it meet growing demand for ChatGPT.

GCP is also providing some of its own compute to OpenAI, per Reuters.

$MSFT $NVDA

Microsoft $MSFT is said to be rolling out a ranking system for AI models based on safety performance, letting cloud customers assess different AI models before use.

$GOOG $AMZN $META

Anthropic last week announced that it is building several US national security-oriented models for government use, with the models able to handle classified information in intelligence and defense contexts.

$MSFT $PLTR $AMZN $GOOG $NVDA

Circle’s $CRCL $31 IPO pricing left ~$1.7 billion on the table, making it the seventh-largest underpricing of all IPOs since 1980, behind Visa $V, Airbnb $ABNB, Snowflake $SNOW, Rivian $RIVN, DoorDash $DASH, and Coupang $CPNG, per Fortune.

Broadcom’s $AVGO new Tomahawk 6 networking chip is expected to reach full production by July, tapping 3nm’s node as the first to feature a chiplet architecture.

Broadcom says the chip will help enable 100K+ GPU clusters. 

$NVDA $AMD
